data.title: Windows: window dimensions shrink after waking up from sleep

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: win 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open vs code in maximum window.
2. let win 10 go to sleep
3. login and vscode window shrink to small size and went to top left corner

data.title: Remember width for each sidebar panel
data.body:
It would be nice if the width would be remembered for each individual panel.

The problem I face now is that I'm constantly readjusting the sidebar width because I need it wide when debugging or searching, and prefer it visible but not too wide otherwise (e.g. explorer).

data.title: Can't format CSS anymore
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Just now, I tried to format my CSS, but VS Code doesn't seem to support formatting CSS. Formatting JS and HTML works superb, but CSS simply doesn't anymore. It used to work didn't it?

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VS Code.
2. Open folder to a random folder.
3. Add a CSS file.
4. Type some random CSS:

```
body{
background:blue;
}
```

When I try formatting it with Alt+Shift+F, no spaces or indenting are added. I then tried to do it through the right mousebutton click menu, but the option 'Format code' is not present. If I create a JavaScript file and type some random JavaScript in there:

```
if(1==1){
console.log('yay');
}
```

Then the format code shortcut works. The menu item 'Format code' on right mouse button click is present as well.

No errors/warnings in the console.

JP

data.title: Menu bar not accessible with keyboard when Integrated Terminal has focus
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  open integrated terminal (CTRL+`)
2. focus the terminal (click on it) 
3. press  any combination with the keyboard to try and open a menu, (ALT+V for the view menu)
4. Notice that pressing ALT does highlight the menu Underline hints, but no menu pops up when using proper keyboard navigation

data.title: vscode insiders (after update) doesn't highlight and tell about TS errors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: insiders
- OS Version: windows 10

After todays update of vscode insiders stopped to highlight and tell about TS errors in some projects:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/736697/18745730/da6da6b2-80dc-11e6-9ffd-33c2d31a819c.png)

And this is another project (small) where errors are highlighted:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/736697/18745761/f517e91e-80dc-11e6-8a78-17c9b60b0c1a.png)

Both 2.1dev version of TS.

What may be the reason?

data.title: A failed setBP request during configuration - configurationDone never fired
data.body: During configuration, if one of the setBP requests returns with `success: false`, then configurationDone is never fired. It seems like those failures should be ignored, and the breakpoints grayed out, so the process can move on, so it can be as failure-resistant as possible.

data.title: Internal source file reference changes on each step
data.body:
Usually when stepping, the viewport doesn't shift unless it needs to, like when the current line runs off the bottom. But when stepping through some scripts, it shifts on every step. I think this is for scripts that vscode doesn't have on disk (that had their source provided by the debug adapter) but I don't know why that would make a difference.

Good:
![sep-22-2016 12-20-15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/18744600/f95fa098-80be-11e6-8cca-184bbf659ac1.gif)

Bad:
![sep-22-2016 12-19-27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/18744602/fb5bebb8-80be-11e6-8ba9-da36a88d5d2f.gif)

data.title: Can't copy/paste version from VS Code about window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: See below
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64 with Anniversary Update

See screenshot:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3898363/18741167/8adc9ed2-80a5-11e6-9fc0-d73d3b615b6f.png)

I can't copy paste my version from there to enter it into the VSCode Version above when creating GitHub issues.

It would be better if it displayed my OS version too so I could copy paste that too.

And what would be super duper awesome is if when I clicked the smiley face in the bottom right corner of the editor and clicked "Submit a bug" it would automatically populate these things inside the issue for me. Something like this:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34146618/pre-populate-the-github-new-issue-form-using-the-querystring

That would be super slick! Go VSCode team!

![sep-22-2016 09-33-45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/18740025/c043d4ee-80a7-11e6-812e-e892db65f88e.gif)

data.title: Find in files only gives results for recently opened files
data.body:
- VSCode Version:152
- OS Version:10Ann

Steps to Reproduce:
1. close all open files and restart vscode (opening the same folder/project)
2. use ctrl+shift+f  (or whatever your shortcut is for finding within files)
3. type in a word that is in multiple files within the current folder/project
4. press enter
5. see that the results from one or more, (or all), files are not found
6. open one of the files
7. re-run search
8. see that the results for that file are now listed
9. open all other files one by one, re-running the search each time
10. see that results are only given for files that have been opened recently

This happened for me using xml files with the searched for word between arrow brackets. (e. g. ">word<")

data.title: Add preference to delete files permanently by default.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu

When running vscode on a server (`ssh -Y ...` to that server), delete to trash bin seems not working. You will get an error msg every time when deleting a file. This is annoying.

![vscode_delete_permantly](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9464825/18738960/bf843262-80d2-11e6-8711-5d7f913005af.png)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. login to another machine via `ssh -Y ...` and run `code` there.
2. try to delete a file.

data.title: Code is not getting a proper focus when opening from command line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 7
- **Not** running VSCode as administrator or with any compatibility options enabled.

I'm not sure if this is a _bug report_ or a _feature request_, so please let me know if this is happening just to me / just to Windows 7 / etc.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use command line to open VSCode _(with or without a file being specified)_
2. Behold at the blinking Code's taskbar item and not at the Code's window, which - by my opinion - should have been thrown on the top of other windows.

**Some visual context:**

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860713/18738777/0ed7d596-809f-11e6-839c-9a97790fa516.gif)

This is happening when I'm trying to run Code from/using:
- WScript's `shell.exec()`
- Total Commander's command line _(as in the pic)_
- Windows' `cmd.exe`

data.body:

As some extensions create many output channels like in the figure below, there does not exist a way to kill these windows.

![vscode_output_channel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9464825/18738634/0c43528e-80d0-11e6-8f32-c2dc2a98b107.png)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install `Runner` extension.
2. Run something multiple times.

data.title: [shellscript] validate end of line character

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  Version 1.5.2
  Commit 66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b
  Date 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z
  Shell 0.37.6
  Renderer 49.0.2623.75
  Node 5.10.0
- OS Version:
  Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a dosomething.sh file in c:\repro\
2. place the following in the file

```
#!/bin/bash
echo hello from the cozy container
```
1. run:
   `docker run -it -v c:/repro:/src debian src/dosomething.sh`
2. Response:
   `standard_init_linux.go:175: exec user process caused "no such file or directory"`
   Which starts you down the crazy train as you know it’s there but question if you got all the Linux things right:
   Did you lean forward / lean backward \
   Did you get the ./ correct?
   Was volume mounting correct?
   Ahhhhhhhhh
3. use `Dos2Linux` to fix the file
4. learn VS Code has a nice option in the corner to switch to lf
5. `docker run -it -v c:/repro:/src debian src/dosomething.sh`
6. Response:
   `hello from the cozy container`
7. Look for a way to customize a specific language (bash)
8. log a bug hoping the VS Code team will just fix *.sh files to always use just lf
9. [blog that VS Code rocks, and hope it will fix the default](http://running-scripts-in-a-docker-container-from-windows-cr-or-crlf)

data.title: Word Wrap is imprecise with non-monospace fonts

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm seeing a wide right margin in my  editor when I have word wrap on.
![widemargin](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1505427/18737217/0f1066ca-804c-11e6-9bd8-281f0a56fe67.PNG)
I don't see this on other computers.  Not sure what's up.  This is all I have in my user settings:
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
 "editor.tabSize": 2,
 "editor.insertSpaces": true,
 "editor.fontSize": 21,
 "editor.fontFamily": "Source Code Pro",
 "git.enabled": false
}

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Turn on Word Wrap (alt-z)

data.title: Cannot tab to snippet variable
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create snippet with multiple variables.
2. Activate snippet in editor
3. Update first variable
4. Hit tab, enter, anything -- cursor will not jump to next variable position.

Notes: 
- Tab does just that, tabs.
- Enter seems to exit snippet mode, but also doesn't jump
- The following is set in keyboard shortcuts: 

``` json
{ "key": "tab", "command": "jumpToNextSnippetPlaceholder",
                 "when": "editorTextFocus && inSnippetMode" },
```

Example of expected behavior -- the below behavior does not work in 1.5.2 as far as I can tell.
![](https://github.com/johnpapa/vscode-angular2-snippets/raw/master/images/use-extension.gif)

Snippet from: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=johnpapa.Angular2
